author: Tom Hopkinson
title: Arsene Wenger will carry on managing for another four years - even if he leaves Arsenal this summer
text:
Arsene Wenger could leave Arsenal this summer (Photo: Reuters) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsene Wenger insists he will go on managing for another FOUR years at least. 
But the Frenchman ­admitted for the first time on Friday that those added years might not now be with Arsenal . 
Wenger is adamant that his ­preference is to stay at the Emirates. 
And the beleaguered boss made clear that he has no desire to ­follow Sir Alex Ferguson on to the speaking circuit – or do anything else at all, other than football management. 
Given that Arsenal owner Stan Kroenke and chief executive Ivan Gazidis are highly unlikely to force him out, those words will alarm the ever-growing number of fans who are desperate to see the back of the 67-year-old boss. 
Wenger was under fierce ­pressure from a growing section of Arsenal supporters to quit the club when his contract expires in the summer even before Wednesday’s 5-1 Champions League humiliation at Bayern Munich. 
That result saw the criticism of Wenger reach unprecedented levels and sources at the club ­believe he is as close as he has ever been to walking away. (Photo: Getty) 
Arsenal chiefs at war over Arsene Wenger replacement as Thierry Henry lined up in new management set up 
Wenger will make a final ­decision on his future in March or April – but he is adamant it will be some time yet before he quits frontline ­management. 
Asked if the board should ­perceive his ‘four more years’ declaration of intent as a threat, he said: “No, not at all. 
“My preference is always to manage Arsenal and I have shown that. 
“But I think I am adult enough to analyse the situation. 
“Ferguson has some other ­interests in life and he was older than I am today. He was four years older, he retired at 71 and I’m 67. 
“Maybe I will do four seasons more, maybe less, I don’t know. Everybody is different. 
“I do not want to take anything away from Ferguson, he was an ­absolutely unbelievable manager. But he had had enough. I’m not at that stage.” (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty) 
Wenger refused to divulge whether or not he had offers from other clubs but over the years Real Madrid, Paris Saint-Germain and the FA, among others, have ­coveted his services. 
For now, he must refocus his players ahead of tomorrow’s tricky trip to Sutton in the FA Cup. 
Hope 
But he insists he has not given up hope of closing the gap on Chelsea in the Premier League. 
Wenger added: “You keep ­defeats like Wednesday’s with you for your whole life but... 
“The FA Cup isn’t the only ­competition... the championship is not over and we have to fight for the championship as well. 
“The future gives you hope. The next game is part of the future.” Like us on Facebook
